meanings.definition: Resembling flint in hardness or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The rock was so flintlike that it could easily scratch glass.
meanings.sent2: Her eyes had a flintlike gaze that could pierce through any facade.
meanings.sent3: The flintlike stone refused to budge no matter how hard I tried to move it.
meanings.sent4: His flintlike determination to succeed propelled him to achieve his goals.
meanings.sent5: The flintlike texture of the metal made it nearly indestructible.

meanings.sent1: The warrior's flintlike resolve never wavered in the face of danger.
meanings.sent2: The flintlike nature of the material made it ideal for creating sparks.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, he possessed a flintlike strength that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her flintlike wit could cut through any argument with ease.
meanings.sent5: The flintlike character of the protagonist made him a formidable opponent.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's flintlike rules left no room for negotiation.
meanings.sent2: The old man had a flintlike stubbornness that refused to accept defeat.
meanings.sent3: The flintlike resistance of the material made it perfect for withstanding pressure.
meanings.sent4: Her flintlike personality clashed with his more easygoing nature.
meanings.sent5: The flintlike surface of the road made it difficult to walk on.
